dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Hey, B, did you see this really interesting piece about JPMorgan Chase today?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Hey, B, did you see this really interesting piece about J P Morgan Chase today?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Oh yeah? What's up with them?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh yeah? What's up with them?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: So, they're actually expanding their efforts to hire people with criminal backgrounds. Like, really leaning into that "second chance" thing.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So, they're actually expanding their efforts to hire people with criminal backgrounds. Like, really leaning into that second chance thing.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: JPMorgan Chase announced an expansion of its efforts to hire people with criminal backgrounds Monday, continuing the trend of big companies banning the box and giving people second chances.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Wow, J.P. Morgan, huh? That's kinda big. I mean, you don't always think of, uh, big banks doing that.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Wow, J P Morgan, huh? That's kinda big. I mean, you don't always think of, uh, big banks doing that.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Right? And get this: in 2018, they hired 2,100 people with records. That's actually 10% of their total hires for that year.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right? And get this: in twenty eighteen, they hired two thousand, one hundred people with records. That's actually ten percent of their total hires for that year.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: JPMorgan Chase hired 2,100 people with criminal records in 2018, which equals about 10% of their total hires last year.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Whoa, 10%? That's significant. So they just, like, don't ask about it on the application? That "ban the box" thing?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Whoa, ten percent? That's significant. So they just, like, don't ask about it on the application? That ban the box thing?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly. They do background checks, but only *after* a job offer has been made. It's mostly for entry-level stuff, like account servicing.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly. They do background checks, but only after a job offer has been made. It's mostly for entry-level stuff, like account servicing.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The bank knows those people have records, because they conduct background checks on applicants after a job offer has been made. Applicants with criminal records are being considered for entry-level jobs like account servicing and transaction processing, according to the banks press release.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Hmm, that makes sense. And I bet the tight labor market is probably playing a role there too, right?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Hmm, that makes sense. And I bet the tight labor market is probably playing a role there too, right?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, totally. I mean, the unemployment rate for formerly incarcerated people is 27%, compared to like, 3.5% nationally. So it's a huge pool.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, totally. I mean, the unemployment rate for formerly incarcerated people is twenty seven percent, compared to like, three point five percent nationally. So it's a huge pool.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The unemployment rate for formerly incarcerated people is 27%, while the nationwide unemployment rate is 3.5%, according to the bank.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, for sure. And it's not just J.P. Morgan either, is it? I feel like I've heard about other big companies doing this.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, for sure. And it's not just J P Morgan either, is it? I feel like I've heard about other big companies doing this.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: You got it. Koch Industries, Starbucks, McDonald's, Target, Home Depot... they've all been increasing these hiring efforts since at least 2013.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: You got it. Koch Industries, Starbucks, McDonald's, Target, Home Depot... they've all been increasing these hiring efforts since at least twenty thirteen.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Koch Industries, Starbucks, McDonalds, Target and Home Depot are among other corporations that have increased hiring efforts of the formerly incarcerated since at least 2013.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: That's really encouraging. And, uh, I heard somewhere that there's a massive economic benefit to this too.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: That's really encouraging. And, uh, I heard somewhere that there's a massive economic benefit to this too.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Absolutely. The bank actually said the U.S. loses up to $87 billion annually in GDP by excluding these folks from the workforce. Eighty-seven billion!
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Absolutely. The bank actually said the U S loses up to eighty seven billion dollars annually in G D P by excluding these folks from the workforce. Eighty-seven billion!
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The U.S. loses up to $87 billion annually in GDP by excluding people with criminal backgrounds from the workforce, said the bank.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: [interrupts] That's a huge number! It just makes so much sense, like, economically and, you know, morally.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: That's a huge number! It just makes so much sense, like, economically and, you know, morally.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: And it's all tied into this "ban the box" movement. It's been growing for two decades now. Removing that question from applications.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And it's all tied into this ban the box movement. It's been growing for two decades now. Removing that question from applications.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Banning the box refers to removing questions about criminal backgrounds from job applications, a movement thats been growing over the past two decades.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Which is so important, especially when you consider, um, the demographics. Like, a disproportionate number of Black and Hispanic people are affected.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Which is so important, especially when you consider, um, the demographics. Like, a disproportionate number of Black and Hispanic people are affected.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: According to the Pew Research Center, as of April black and Hispanic people make up 56% of the jailed population, leading experts to believe the groups are unfairly discriminated against in hiring.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly. Experts say they're unfairly discriminated against. But, uh, laws are changing. 35 states, over 150 cities and counties have "ban the box" laws.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly. Experts say they're unfairly discriminated against. But, uh, laws are changing. thirty five states, over one hundred fifty cities and counties have ban the box laws.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: ...as of April black and Hispanic people make up 56% of the jailed population, leading experts to believe the groups are unfairly discriminated against in hiring. But ban the box legislation began to pass in the early 2000s, with laws on the books in 35 states and over 150 cities and counties as of July, according to the National Employment Law Project.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: And then you've got the First Step Act too, right? All of this really points to a shifting attitude, I think, towards these workers.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And then you've got the First Step Act too, right? All of this really points to a shifting attitude, I think, towards these workers.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: And the 2018 First Step Act means thousands of people could be eligible for early release from prison, on top of the 700,000 already released annually signaling a shifting political attitude towards these workers, according to FastCompany.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, it's definitely a positive trend, you know? Giving people a real shot.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, it's definitely a positive trend, you know? Giving people a real shot.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Totally. Good on them, I say.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Totally. Good on them, I say.
